document_data.mainbody:
Mamur Island was part of Al-Tarik Islands in the Golden Gulf and Crowded Sea within west Zakhara.
Located just northeast of the much larger Tarikat Island, MaMur Island was roughly circular in shape with a diameter of . The island was surrounded by coral reefs. This otherwise insignificant island was the location of mysterious ruins that, as of 1367 DR, remained unexplored.
